results.title: Australian Aborigines: living off the land
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land this film shows how Aborigines live on native animals and plants.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: art, life and religion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Modern social studies”.
A simple portrayal of the aborigines’ belief that the spirit world and the material world are very closely linked. The spiritual significance of painting their bodies, dancing and singing is explained. Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, led by Professor A. P. Elkin in 1952.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: songs and dances
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the Sydney University’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land. This film shows the musical instruments of the Aborigines and contrasts the songs and dances of different tribes. The story behind every song and dance is told by the commentator.
results.description:

results.title: A Caribbean mystery
results.creator_credit: Christopher Petit, George Gallaccio and BBC Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple, (Joan Hickson) is far away from her home in quiet St. Mary Mead. However, even in the tropical paradise of the Caribbean, her powers of observation and keen understanding of human nature is required to solve the murder of Major Pulgrave at the Golden Palm Hotel. When others become victims to the unknown murderer she knows it’s vital for her to crack the case. Also stars Donald Pleasence.

results.title: The Body in the library
results.creator_credit: Silvio Narizzano, Guy Slater and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
This Agatha Christie story is set in the deceptively sleepy English village of St Mary Mead during the late 1940s. One morning Colonel and Mrs Bantry awake to discover the corpse of an unknown platinum blonde on the hearthrug in their library. Mrs Bantry turns to her neighbour, Jane Marple, who comes at once to investigate, with the constabulary close on her heels. The police follow their official lines of inquiry, but Miss Marple has her own idea. Her instincts warn her that another disaster is close at hand, and when she is proved right she sets out to trap the ruthless double murderer.

results.title: A Pocketful of Rye
results.creator_credit: Guy Slater, George Gallaccio and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
In this sinister tale, set in the 1940’s, Miss Marple sets about unravelling the mysterious murder of city financier, Rex Fortesque. When the cause of death is identified as poisoning, suspicion falls on the occupants of the family home, Yew Tree Lodge. But the police are perplexed as the only clue to the murder is a handful of rye in the dead man’s pocket. However, when another murder shortens the life of suspects, the connection with the nursery rhyme “Sing a Song of Sixpence” is all too clear to Miss Marple.

results.title: A Murder is announced
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Guy Slater and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Everyone in Chipping Cleghorn thinks that the advertisement in the local paper is a joke - but the villagers are intrigued by this new style of party game, and turn out in force at the appointed hour. They are not disappointed. As the clock strikes seven, the lights go out, the door to the drawing room swings open, a torch beam plays around the room - and three shots ring out. Then a body slumps at the door. It is no longer a game. Inspector Craddock and everyone present agree that the dead man shot himself. Miss Marple thinks differently. Stars Joan Hickson as Miss Marple.

results.title: Miss Marple Series
results.brief_description: A series of films adapted from Agatha Christie’s books featuring Miss Marple, a sweet little old lady who lives in the village of St. Mary Mead and happens to be one of England’s greatest detectives! Each story, as well as being a murder mystery, also depicts English village life between the wars. Stars Joan Hickson as Miss Marple.

results.title: They do it with mirrors
results.creator_credit: Norman Stone, George Gallaccio, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple’s keen powers of observation and detection are put to good use at Stonygates, the rambling country house where her friend Carrie-Louise (Jean Simmons) and husband Lewis run a reformatory for young criminals. Shots are fired in a dark room but the victim is discovered elsewhere. Miss Marple soon identifies the killer. Once again, Joan Hickson plays the ever popular Miss Marple.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Stone, George Gallaccio, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC

results.title: 4.50 from Paddington
results.creator_credit: Martyn Friend, George Gallaccio and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Elspeth McGillicuddy travels from London to St. Mary Mead to visit her old friend Miss Marple, catching the 4.50 train from Paddington. On the way the train draws to a halt and another train draws alongside. In the carriage opposite the blind suddenly snaps up. Glancing across, Mrs McGillicuddy witnesses a sight she will never forget. Almost immediately the train chugs away, leaving the image printed in Mrs. McGillicuddy’s mind - she has witnessed a murder! Stars Joan Hickson as Miss Marple.
